meanings.definition: Make a sound as liquid is poured from a bottle.
meanings.sent1: The water was glugging out of the bottle.
meanings.sent2: I heard the glugging noise as the soda poured into the glass.
meanings.sent3: The glugging sound of the milk made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The glugging of the river reminded me of a happy song.
meanings.sent5: She imitated the glugging of the bottle to entertain the kids.

meanings.definition: The act of making a glugging sound.
meanings.sent1: The glugging was loud as the drink poured.
meanings.sent2: I love the glugging of a fresh pour.
meanings.sent3: The glugging in the movie made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like the glugging of a stream.
meanings.sent5: The glugging of the fountain was soothing to listen to.

meanings.definition: Pouring liquid in a noisy or gurgling manner.
meanings.sent1: She was glugging the juice into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The glugging of the waterfall was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The glugging of the tea sounded like a tiny storm.
meanings.sent4: The rain glugging on the roof was a comforting sound.
meanings.sent5: He glugging the paint into the can with a steady hand.
